meanings.definition: A person who is bound or obligated to fulfill a duty or promise.
meanings.sent1: The obligor promised to finish their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: The obligor is expected to pay back the borrowed money.
meanings.sent3: The obligor made a pact with their friend to share snacks every day.
meanings.sent4: As the obligor of the group project, Sarah ensured everyone contributed equally.
meanings.sent5: The obligor's commitment to volunteer at the shelter was unwavering.

meanings.definition: The party who is responsible for fulfilling an obligation or debt.
meanings.sent1: The obligor agreed to repay the loan by the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: The obligor of the contract must adhere to the terms stated.
meanings.sent3: The obligor of the bet ended up winning the jackpot unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: As the obligor of the family reunion planning, Mark ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The obligor's determination to clear the debt was commendable.
